title: Yasuo's {Passive} might be changed because everyone can have it, But Wukong's Stone skin won't?
body:
For anyone who doesnt know what I'm talking about, {{champion:62}} 's Passive is called {Stone Skin} and it gives you 8 armor+MR for each nearby enemy at lvl 16 resulting in 40 additional Armor and MR lategame.  
The design team created an item {{item:3193}} that gives the same passive with the same name {Stone Skin} but gives you 40 Armor + MR with only 3 nearby enemies.

and now that the new {{item:3031}} doubles your critical strike {Yasuo's Passive} , the design team is thinking of changing {{champion:157}}'s passive because of that, or at least it's one of the reasons.

You see, you have the ability to work on any champion and hot fix them in a day, but because Wukong is not popular at all , yeah, you still have no idea what to do with him.

Bonus: now Wukong's passive is even less existent because of the Last whisper changes.

Because Wukong functions without the passive, his passive was never relevant because it never needed to be. Go back to before this patch and take away Yasuo passive and watch how utter shit he becomes. Wukong is shit too but that's a numbers thing since he's a stat check champion who will either kill you instantly or do no damage.

The difference is that Wukong's passive *can* reliably stack, and it is in no way hampered or affected by the existence of Stoneplate.

Meanwhile, Yasuo's double crit passive is *actually* hindering him at this point, since he significantly overcaps on crit with just two items now (meaning he can't afford *both* Shiv and PD, as they'd be just terrible items for him), has reduced crit damage, and is just taking away from his power budget.

There is nothing similar about Wukong's passive. Hell, even if he *did* go into Stoneplate, it'd just *amplify* it. He has nothing hindering him at all because of that.

Is his passive bad? Yeah. Is it the same situation? Not at all.
